intro: Melanthera brownii, commonly known as the brown's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and distinctive, inflated pods that resemble bladders. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. Melanthera brownii is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
